alert.note: Alert for Boone (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 06 at 2:23PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN RIPLEY, DEARBORN, NORTH CENTRAL BOONE AND NORTHWESTERN HAMILTON COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM EST... At 222 PM EST, a strong thunderstorm was located near Moores Hill, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Harrison, North College Hill, Cheviot, Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Bright, Hidden Valley, Cleves, Milan, Shawnee, Moores Hill, Taylor Creek, Bridgetown, Miami Heights, Dry Ridge, Blue Jay, Dunlap, Mack and Delhi Township. This includes the following Interstates... I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 154 and 171. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
